intro: Stypandra imbricata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stypandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Stypandra imbricata is typically found in sandy soils and is often associated with coastal or inland heathland environments. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height, with woody stems and small, elliptical leaves.
